node.title: Passengers on two Queensland flights told to quarantine for Christmas after positive COVID case
node.alt: A virgin airlines plane on the tarmac at sydney airport
node.description: People who flew from Brisbane to Townsville and from Newcastle to Brisbane, the first flight since Queensland's border reopened, are deemed close contacts and willÂ spend Christmas in quarantine.
node.content: ["Queensland has\u00a0recorded one\u00a0new community case of COVID-19, a person who took two flights in the state.", "The positive case was on Virgin flights VA 1105, Newcastle to Brisbane, and VA 375, Brisbane to Townsville, on Monday.", "All passengers on each flight have been deemed close contacts and will be forced to spend Christmas in quarantine.", "People have been urged to regularly check the Queensland Health website for the latest exposure sites.", "\"We can confirm these flights and exposure sites are in relation to a new positive COVID-19 case and more information will be provided [today],\" Queensland Health said in a statement.", "All passengers on both flights have been deemed close contacts and must get tested and quarantine for 14 days, meaning they will spend Christmas in quarantine.", "Newcastle is currently grappling with a rapidly-growing COVID-19 cluster, linked to a superspreader event at a nightclub and likely involving the new Omicron variant.", "Case numbers in the city have exploded after a 1970s-themed prom night at the Argyle House\u00a0last week.", "More than 200 of the 650 people who attended the event have tested positive to COVID-19.", "Genomic sequencing is underway to confirm whether the cases have the Omicron variant.", "Currently, people deemed close contacts in Queensland are required to immediately get tested for COVID-19, contact Queensland Health and isolate for 14 days, even if they test negative.", "However, from January 1, fully vaccinated people who are deemed close contacts will only need to quarantine for seven days \u2013 if they test negative on day five of the isolation period.", "Currently, unvaccinated people are still able to arrive by air into Queensland from hotspots, however,\u00a0they must hotel quarantine for 14 days."]
